title: Rapper Pa Salieu wins BBC Sound of 2021: 'I am the voice of the voiceless'
description: Songs about life on the "frontline" help him be named the most exciting talent for the coming year.

title: QAnon: What is it and where did it come from?
description: The fringe conspiracy theory is facing a crackdown by social media platforms, although it's been growing especially in the US.

title: Georgia election: Trump voter fraud claims and others fact-checked
description: President Trump and others have made unsubstantiated claims of fraud in two Senate election run-offs.

title: Trump: 'We will never give up, we will never concede'
description: President Donald Trump spoke to thousands of supporters who'd gathered for the "Save America" rally.

title: Senate suspends debate due to protesters
description: As Trump supporters entered the US Capitol building, politicians halted debate inside.

title: Brains 'is the taste of Cardiff, it's in our DNA'
description: One notable Cardiffian likens the city losing its Brains brewery to Melton Mowbray losing its pies.

title: Georgia election: Who is Reverend Raphael Warnock?
description: Rev Warnock looks set to make history as Georgia's first black senator, but what do we know of him?

title: Rostrevor: Giant effort to save 'Finn McCool's leaning tree'
description: Work is under way to try to preserve a curiously-slanted 200-year-old holm oak in County Down.

title: National security law: Mass arrests among Hong Kong pro-democracy camp
description: The arrests of around 50 people appear linked to primaries the opposition held ahead of elections.

title: Georgia Senate election on knife-edge in vote count
description: Republicans Kelly Loeffler and David Perdue are neck and neck with Democrats Raphael Warnock and Jon Ossoff.

title: The Papers: 'Tough curbs for months' and '1 in 50 have virus'
description: Wednesday's front pages focus on "stark" infection rates in England, and the vaccination programme.

title: US Congress set to certify Joe Biden victory amid protests
description: Donald Trump says he will address supporters protesting against the certification of his defeat.

title: Covid: England's third national lockdown legally comes into force
description: MPs will debate and retrospectively vote on the new measures later amid surging coronavirus cases.

title: Covid: WHO team investigating virus origins denied entry to China
description: Visas had not been cleared for team members already en route to probe the origins of the virus.

title: Trump bans Alipay and seven other Chinese apps
description: The latest executive order by the US president will only take effect after he has left office.

title: Stuck in Taiwan, a Brit spearheads campaign to clean up river
description: Peter Lowe noticed the problem after getting stuck in Taiwan during the pandemic.

title: 'Deepfake porn images still give me nightmares'
description: Poet Helen Mort is calling for a change in the law after images of her were edited with porn.

title: Analysis: Can lockdown stop the new coronavirus variant?
description: There are concerns the new variant may spread too easily to be controlled by lockdown.

title: The Lagos Third Mainland Bridge: Six months of traffic woe in Nigeria
description: Commuters in Nigeria's most populous city have been dealing with the partial closure of a busy link.

title: Coronavirus: Dutch shocked to be EU vaccination stragglers
description: Caution and bureaucracy have made the Dutch last in the EU to start vaccinating against Covid-19.

title: BBC Sound of 2021: Holly Humberstone wants her lyrics to be tattoo-worthy
description: The 21-year-old's "painfully honest" pop songs have made her runner-up in the BBC's Sound of 2021.

title: Covid: 12 life tasks in lockdown - what has changed?
description: From registering a birth to getting a plumber. not everything is the same as during the first lockdown.

title: FTSE 100 chief executives 'earn average salary within 3 days'
description: FTSE 100 chiefs will on Wednesday already have earned more this year than the average workers' annual wage.

title: Parents and students react to school closures in England
description: Parents spoke to the BBC after Monday's announcement about school closures in England.

title: Coronavirus: Arrivals in UK could soon need negative test
description: The government says it is considering the move to prevent the virus spreading "across the UK border".

title: Palm cockatoo: Why a unique ‘drumming’ bird is in peril
description: The palm cockatoo is thought to be the only bird to use tools musically to attract a mate.

title: Final is Tottenham's reward for taking EFL Cup seriously, says Mourinho
description: Moussa Sissoko and Son Heung-min score either side of half-time to send Tottenham into the Carabao Cup final.

title: A tourist, in Afghanistan?
description: Conflict has made Afghanistan an unlikely tourist destination, but a blogger is bucking the trend.

title: UK new car registrations in 2020 sink to 30-year low
description: New 2020 car registrations sink to a 30-year low and see biggest one-year drop since the Second World War

title: Jimmy Carter: The story behind the Premier League's first British Asian player
description: Jimmy Carter was the first British Asian to play in the Premier League, but almost nobody realised and 11 years passed before another followed.
